edu.uwa.aidan.robot.world
Class AgentWorld

java.lang.Object
  edu.uwa.aidan.robot.world.AgentWorld

public class AgentWorld
extends java.lang.Object

Agent world is the simulated world in which the robot will move around in. The AgentWorld is responsible for delegating all of the simulation time steps to all members of the world, as well as storing references to all of the Obstacles that a Robot will encounter whilst attempting to traverse the world. NOTE: this code makes extensive use of the java 2D Shape classes because it represents the simplest and fastest way of implementing 2D geometry. You do NOT have to have a UI running in order to use this code, however this code also provides a paint method if you wish to render the world to a JComponent.

Author:
Aidan Morgan

getWorstFitnessScore

public double getWorstFitnessScore()
Returns the score a Robot will get if it performs in absolutely the worst possible way. This is used because NEAT requires a maximization problem, however goal finding is a problem of minimizing the distance of the Robot from the goal. If we simply subtract the Robots distance from the goal from the value returned by this method, then we get the maximisation problem we require.

Returns:
the score a Robot will get if it performs in absolutely the worst possible way.

setWorstFitnessScore

public void setWorstFitnessScore(double bestFitness)

step

public void step(long stepNum)
Updates everything in the world to the provided stepNum.

Parameters:
stepNum - the current step num.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the world back to default.

copy

public AgentWorld copy()
Creates a copy of this AgentWorld. Note: this will not copy the Robot, it is used for copying the definition of the world to save loading it from disk repeatedly.

Returns:
a copy of this AgentWorld.

canMove

public boolean canMove(java.awt.geom.Point2D lastPoint,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D newPoint)
Returns true if it is possible to move from the Point2D which is the current position, to the Point2D. i.e. is there a "clear" path between the two points.

Parameters:
lastPoint - the current location.
newPoint - the location to move to.
Returns:
true if it is possible to move from the Point2D which is the current position, to the Point2D.
